overview:
McDonald was recognized by Marketing Magazine with the “Ones to Watch” Marketing’s Next Generation Award (Top 30 under 30) and served on the board of directors for the Public Relations Society as Chair of sponsorships. John also serves on the Advisory Board of Tradavo, Inc.

John has founded many businesses and programs such as The Recreation Agency (which was recognized by Promo Magazine as one of America’s Top 100 Advertising Agencies), SmoreStore, BuyOurHouse, The JASM Company and most recently serving as Vice President, Marketing and Business Development for Ticketmaster, an operating business of IAC [Nasdaq: IACI].

Prior to joining Ticketmaster, McDonald spent several years managing the Marketing team at iFarm Network’s national ISP FunCow.com which grew to become one of Canada’s largest ISP’s in its second year of operation, beating AOL for subscribers. While at Funcow, John initiated the first ISP software installation loaded within music artists CD’s in a deal with EMI, garnering worldwide attention for its innovation. In addition, creating ‘FunCash’, an online allowance product, enabling youth to purchase online without the need for a credit card within approved websites across North America. John has also held positions at the Canadian Film Centre, Empry Entertainment and Rothmans, Benson & Hedges.
